items.title: Pfizer shares jump over 7% on Wall Street as pharma giant plans to cut drug prices in US — Details here
items.summary: Pfizer shares jump over 7% on Wall Street as pharma giant plans to cut drug prices in US — Details here

items.title: Home loan weakness a drag on retail credit
items.summary: Industry executives attributed the slowdown to relative reluctance among banks, especially those privately owned, to chase housing loans because of the pressure on margins due to reduction in interest rate, while borrowers are delaying purchases in anticipation of further easing of rates. The slowdown also partly reflects the base effect given last year's numbers had the lingering impact of the HDFC-HDFC Bank merger.

items.title: Rupee loan average rates fall by 6bps in August
items.summary: On outstanding rupee loans, system-wide average lending rates softened by 6 bps month-on-month to 9.32% as of end-August. Private sector lenders reduced rates the most, by 10 bps to 10.22%, while PSU banks trimmed rates by 3 bps to 8.70%. Lending rates of foreign banks remained unchanged.

items.title: Vedanta demerger date moved to March 2026 pending government approval
items.summary: Vedanta Ltd has extended its demerger deadline to March 2026 from September 2025, citing pending NCLT and government approvals. This strategic move aims to unlock greater value by creating four standalone companies. The company recently received a boost when NCLAT allowed TSPL's separation, following a settlement with a Chinese contractor.

items.title: RBI to continue to use overnight weighted average call rate as the operating target for monetary policy
items.summary: It would, however, track other overnight money market segments in a bid to ensure orderly evolution of money market rates and smoothen transmission, the central bank said in the revised liquidity management framework released on Tuesday. "The Reserve Bank will endeavour to align the WACR to the policy repo rate by ensuring optimum level of system liquidity using the instruments defined under this framework," the central bank said.

items.title: Cinema chain PVR INOX faces CCI investigation over fair trade breach
items.summary: The Competition Commission of India has ordered an investigation into PVR INOX. This follows a complaint from a movie producers' body. PVR INOX allegedly charges a digital cinema equipment fee. Producers claim this fee is unfair as the digital transition is complete. The CCI director general will investigate the matter. A report is due in 90 days.

items.title: Probe begins after children die of 'toxic' cough syrup
items.summary: India's drug regulator is investigating child deaths in Rajasthan. Several children died after consuming a "toxic" cough syrup. The Jaipur-based Kayson Pharma manufactured this syrup. Samples are now undergoing testing at a government laboratory. Rajasthan Medical Services Corporation Limited halted the syrup's supply. Two batches are under scrutiny. This follows similar incidents with India-made cough syrups in 2022.

items.title: River Mobility plans $150 mn fundraise to expand production
items.summary: River Mobility, an electric two-wheeler maker, plans to raise $150 million (₹1,332 crore) over the next 2-3 years, with the first tranche expected soon, co-founder and CEO Aravind Mani said. The funds will support launching at least one new product annually from FY27, expanding production capacity, and growing its distribution network.

items.title: Ethical fashion label Stella McCartney ties up with Reliance
items.summary: Reliance Brands partners with Stella McCartney to bring the luxury brand to India. The brand uses animal-free materials. Standalone stores will open in six months. Online sales start soon on Ajio Luxe. This targets India's growing luxury market. The market may reach 90 billion dollars by 2030.

items.title: Bayer seeks approval for key heart drug in India
items.summary: Pharmaceutical major Bayer has filed for Indian approval of its patented drug finerenone (Kerendia) to treat heart failure patients with LVEF of 40 and above. This move aims to address India's growing early-onset heart disease burden. Already approved for chronic kidney disease, Bayer anticipates approval for this new indication by year-end, following successful trials.

items.title: Government reports fiscal gap at 38.1% of FY26 target as of August
items.summary: The Centre's fiscal deficit widened to 38.1% of the annual target by August, driven by higher spending, particularly on capital projects, and lower net tax collections. While front-loading expenditure, the government aims to meet its FY26 deficit target, potentially moderating spending and hoping for improved tax mop-up in coming months.

items.title: India sales of Bvlgari may hit a high this year in difficult global environment, says CEO
items.summary: Bvlgari could see a record year in India in 2025, CEO Jean-Christophe Babin told ET, despite global market challenges. The brand’s India-focused products, including collaborations with Priyanka Chopra like the Kada and Mangalsutra, have performed strongly.

items.title: Grocery, electronics goods sales dip in Sept quarter despite GST goost
items.summary: Sales of large grocery packs, soft drinks, and electronics declined 5-25% in the September quarter. Consumers deferred purchases anticipating lower GST prices, alongside unseasonal rains and inflation. This resulted in a weak Q3, though industry executives expect a recovery in the coming quarters as GST benefits stabilize.

items.title: Indian Cricket's gen-next are fast becoming brand favourites with Shubman Gill, Suryakumar Yadav leading the way
items.summary: With Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma retiring from multiple formats, India’s younger cricketers are stepping into the endorsement spotlight. Stars like Shubman Gill and Suryakumar Yadav are seeing surges in brand value, commanding fees of ₹5 crore and ₹1.5 crore per day, respectively, while emerging players Abhishek Sharma and Tilak Varma are also gaining traction with brands targeting Gen-Z audiences.

items.title: ADB projects India growth at 6.5% for two fiscal years
items.summary: The ADB forecasts India's economic growth at 6.5% for FY26 and FY27, a cut from previous estimates due to high US tariffs on Indian goods. While tariffs will impede growth, strong domestic demand and service exports are expected to cushion the impact, maintaining India's position as a leading regional economy.

items.title: India must grow 12% to address job-skill mismatch: Morgan Stanley
items.summary: India's economy must grow by 12.2% annually to tackle underemployment. This is double the current pace. A 7.4% growth rate is needed to maintain stable unemployment. Youth unemployment remains high at 17.6%. Morgan Stanley projects 6.5% growth, but this may not create enough jobs. AI could also curb future job growth, especially in IT services.

items.title: Self-reliance in focus to counter weaponisation of trade: Piyush Goyal
items.summary: Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal affirmed India's commitment to self-reliance, strengthening supply chains to prevent trade weaponization. He positioned India as a top global investment destination, a stable and rapidly growing economy amidst global volatility. With GDP soaring to 7.8% and recent GST reforms simplifying taxes, India aims to boost consumer spending and economic confidence, while fulfilling its international obligations.

items.title: E-commerce firms under scrutiny for raising prices instead of passing GST cuts
items.summary: The government is closely monitoring e-commerce platforms for failing to pass on GST rate reductions to consumers, with some firms already pulled up for price hikes. Authorities are investigating nearly 3,000 complaints received by the National Consumer Helpline regarding misleading discounts and unfair trade practices post-GST implementation, considering potential class action.

items.title: Government extends RoDTEP by six months to support exporters
items.summary: The government extended the RoDTEP Scheme for exporters. This export support measure was prolonged until March 2026. The scheme refunded taxes and duties to boost export competitiveness. This extension provided relief to exporters facing global challenges. It ensured policy continuity for planning future exports. The move helped sustain momentum in the trade environment.

items.title: Tata Sons listing deadline expires
items.summary: Ball in RBI court

items.title: Telecom spectrum auctions see little competition. Regulator proposes a fix
items.summary: Aggressive bidding for spectrum has eased since 2021, with most of the airwaves sold near reserve prices. Trai suggests allowing entities like providers of internet services and connected data networks to bid for airwaves.

items.title: Jindal Power receives CCI approval to acquire Jaiprakash Associates
items.summary: Jindal Power gets CCI nod to acquire debt-ridden Jaiprakash Associates

items.title: RBI constitutes Payments Regulatory Board headed by Governor
TCS to lay off 30,000 employees? Here's what the IT major has to say amid job cut reports
items.summary: TCS layoffs: The IT major announced a 2% reduction in its workforce, resulting in approximately 12,000 job cuts. A new report suggested that actual layoffs could reach 30,000; however, TCS has denied these claims, insisting the cuts are limited to 2% of its workforce.

items.title: Omega Seiki Mobility introduces autonomous electric 3-Wheeler
FPIs withdraw from Indian equities for third straight month
items.summary: Analysts say the reasons range from tariff uncertainty to dull company earnings for multiple quarters and disproportionately high valuations

items.title: Mumbai property market continues momentum, records best September ever
items.summary: Mumbai's property market recorded its best September ever. Property deals and stamp duty collection reached new highs. Registrations rose 30% from last year. Stamp duty revenue surged 44% to Rs 1,266 crore. This performance defied the traditional slowdown during Pitrupaksha. Strong homebuyer sentiment drove this growth.

items.title: Bombay High Court dismisses MIDC petition against Embassy Developments on Nashik SEZ land
items.summary: The Bombay High Court dismissed MIDC's eviction petition against Indiabulls Industrial Infrastructure for a Sinnar SEZ project, upholding interim relief. The dispute, stemming from a 2007 pact, involves MIDC's claims of undeveloped areas versus Indiabulls' defense of project complexities and sub-leasing. Embassy Developments now aims for an amicable resolution.

items.title: What changes from October 1: Interest on advances, gold metal loans, RBI cheque clearing norms and more
items.summary: From interest on advances, gold metal loans, and RBI cheque clearing norms to PNB service charges, several regulations are set to change from 1 October 2025. Check the list of changes here.

items.title: Poonawalla may acquire IPL team Royal Challengers Bengaluru at $1-1.2 bn valuation
items.summary: This year, RCB won its maiden men's IPL title. Influencer agency Qoruz estimates that the win made the franchise the most valuable in the cricket league, with a brand value exceeding $140 million

items.title: E-commerce under watch: Are GST cuts really reaching shoppers?
items.summary: In cases where the grievance is about consumers not getting price relief due to sellers not lowering price in line with new GST rates, the government may be able to point out the aberration to the company. But what if prices don’t reflect the lower GST rate because sellers raised the base price?

items.title: Adani Green Energy operationalise 408 MW of projects in Khavda
items.summary: Adani Green Energy Ltd (AGEL) on Tuesday said it has commissioned 408 MW of power projects at Khavda in Gujarat, raising its total operational renewable capacity to 16,486.1 MW. The projects were made operational through AGEL’s step-down subsidiaries, the company said in a filing.

items.title: India initiates anti-dumping probe into imports of Chinese PET films, kitchen glassware and nylon
items.summary: India's Commerce Ministry arm DGTR has begun anti-dumping probes. Investigations target PET films, kitchen glassware, and nylon imports. These probes follow complaints from domestic manufacturers. They allege cheap imports from China and other nations. DGTR will determine if dumping caused injury. The finance ministry makes final decisions on duties. This ensures fair trade practices.

items.title: Follow security conditions: DoT to internet providers
items.summary: The Department of Telecommunications instructs internet service providers. They must strictly adhere to license security conditions. This includes rules for foreign personnel deployment. Foreign staff require government security clearance. Majority directors on company boards must be Indian citizens. Key foreign executives need yearly Ministry of Home Affairs vetting. Non-compliance may result in license termination.

items.title: BHEL gets two new orders worth Rs 13-15K crore
items.summary: State-owned BHEL has secured two significant EPC projects from M.P. Power Generating Company Ltd. valued between Rs 13,000-15,000 crore. These orders are for 1x660 MW Amarkantak and 1x660 MW Satpura Supercritical Thermal Power Plants in Madhya Pradesh. Each project is scheduled for completion within 57 months from the notification of award.

items.title: Tata Motors to invest ₹120 crore in Freight Tiger
items.summary: In October 2023, Tata Motors had announced the acquisition of 26.79 per cent stake in ‘Freight Tiger’ for a consideration of Rs 150 crore

items.title: Only 1 in 10 Indian households invested in securities market: SEBI survey
items.summary: SEBI found that while nearly 213 million households are aware of products like mutual funds, ETFs, and stocks, only about 32 million households hold investments

items.title: BPCL to soon start work on refinery-cum-petrochemicals project in AP: N Chandrababu Naidu
items.summary: On the participation of Saudi Arabia in the refinery and petrochemicals complex, Naidu said “They are working on it, As soon as there is progress, I will tell”

items.title: FSIB  recommends R. Chander for MD’s position in LIC
items.summary: The Bureau said it interfaced with 5 candidates from LIC on September 30, 2025 for the position of Managing Director (MD) in the Corporation

items.title: BEL eyes 25 GW renewable capacity by 2030
items.summary: The company, which held its annual general meeting for 2024–25 on Tuesday, reported that its revenue almost doubled to ₹1,571 crore for the financial year

items.title: Sharp surge in silver prices boost Hindustan Zinc’s outlook
items.summary: Ahead of the official inclusion from September 30, the stock climbed from ₹425 to ₹483 on Tuesday, backed by heavy trading volumes, sectoral tailwinds and strong institutional flows

items.title: IVPA favours accelerated push towards edible oil self-sufficiency
items.summary: A media statement by IVPA said that India’s vegetable oils industry is navigating a critical phase marked by global price volatility in palm and soybean oils, evolving free trade agreements, and domestic policy challenges

items.title: RBI launches scheme to reduce stock of unclaimed deposits by incentivising banks
items.summary: The Reserve Bank of India launched a year-long incentive scheme for banks, effective October 1, to reduce unclaimed deposits. Banks will receive differential payouts, ranging from 5% to 7.5% of the amount (or fixed caps), based on how long accounts have been inoperative. This aims to encourage banks to reactivate accounts and return over Rs 67,000 crore to rightful claimants.

items.title: Aequs IPO: Precision component maker to raise up to Rs 720 crore via issue of fresh shares
items.summary: Aequs Limited, a precision component manufacturer for aerospace and consumer sectors, files updated draft prospectus with Sebi for an IPO to raise Rs 720 crore, including a 31.77 million-share offer for sale.

items.title: Gas price for Reliance-bp cut by 3%, domestic rates remain unchanged
items.summary: Two different formulas govern rates paid for gas produced from legacy or old fields of national oil companies like ONGC and OIL, and for newer fields lying in difficult-to-tap areas like deepsea

items.title: Sebi, stock exchanges waive fines, penalties on Unitech
items.summary: Sebi, NSE, and BSE have waived fines on Unitech for past non-compliances and will shift its shares from the restricted Z category to actively traded B category from October 7.

items.title: Tata Motors to infuse additional Rs 120 crores in Freight Tiger
items.summary: Tata Motors announced a further investment of Rs 120 crore in Freight Commerce Solutions. This brings its total commitment to Freight Tiger to Rs 270 crore. The company aims to transform logistics using artificial intelligence. Tata Motors also established a new subsidiary in the Netherlands. This entity will manage business interests.

items.title: Pakistan's KSE 100 index rallies 8,000 points in 6 unbeaten sessions. 2 reasons why
items.summary: Pakistan’s KSE 100 index surged nearly 8,000 points in six sessions, hitting a 52-week high amid improving US ties and a strategic defence pact with Saudi Arabia, boosting investor sentiment and top stock performances.

items.title: IMEC, Italy and India: A corridor linking the Mediterranean and the Indo-Pacific
items.summary: The Indo-Mediterranean Corridor is central to global connectivity. Italian and Indian officials discussed its prospects in Rome. This initiative connects trade, security, and diplomacy. The corridor strengthens Middle Eastern stability and enhances Asia-Europe trade. A new India-EFTA trade deal enters force soon. Italy and India deepen cooperation for this project.

items.title: Nestle India signs MoU with the central government to expedite investment in food sector
items.summary: Nestle India signed an MoU with the Ministry of Food Processing Industries to expedite investments in greenfield and brownfield projects across Odisha and existing manufacturing sites over the next 2-3 years. This initiative, part of its Rs 5,000 crore expansion plan by 2025, aims to create employment and boost capabilities, including a new factory in Odisha.

items.title: New India Assurance ordered to pay 23.79 billion rupees by tax authority
items.summary: New India Assurance (NIA), the country’s largest state-run general insurer, has been directed to pay ₹23.79 billion by the local tax authority over alleged past dues, the company said in a regulatory filing on Tuesday.

items.title: Israeli Stocks Rise to Record After Trump Unveils Gaza Plan
items.summary: Israeli stocks rose to a record high, cementing their fifth successive quarterly rally, as investors bet that a 20-point plan agreed to by Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and US President Donald Trump could hasten the end of the war in Gaza.

items.title: Oil slips as OPEC  plan adds to expectations of supply surplus
items.summary: GLOBAL-OIL:Oil slips as OPEC  plan adds to expectations of supply surplus

items.title: TVS SCS North America grows at 20% CAGR; aims to achieve $500 million in revenue
items.summary: The company has also inaugurated its new 225,000 sq-ft build-to-suit facility in Waterloo, Iowa to expands its footprint in the US Midwest and strengthens its ability to serve local manufacturers and key clients

items.title: Gold hovers near record high on US government shutdown fears, soft jobs data
items.summary: GLOBAL-PRECIOUS:Gold hovers near record high on US government shutdown fears, soft jobs data

items.title: India building self-reliance, resilient supply chains to counter weaponisation of trade: Piyush Goyal
items.summary: Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal announced India's focus on self-reliance and resilient supply chains to counter trade weaponisation, amidst global disruptions including US tariffs. Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister N Chandrababu Naidu highlighted the state's efforts to attract investments in technology, steel, and petrochemicals, with plans for a quantum valley and major industrial projects.

items.title: Indian filmmakers say too early to assess impact of Donald Trump's 100% tariff proposal
items.summary: Indian film producers and distributors are taking a wait-and-watch approach after US President Donald Trump announced a possible 100% tariff on foreign-made films. While the impact on Hindi films may be limited—since the US contributes 6–7% of their revenue—South Indian films could see a 5–6% revenue hit. The effect on streaming platforms and implementation details remain unclear.

items.title: Italian Tile Maker Pitches Debt Haircut as Performance Slows
items.summary: A family-owned Italian ceramic-tile maker is asking its bank lenders to accept a steep writedown following a further decline in performance, after initially proposing a debt restructuring that avoided a haircut for creditors.

items.title: Sebi survey finds nearly 10 pc of Indian households invest in securities
items.summary: Sebi survey finds nearly 10 pc of Indian households invest in securities

items.title: Bank credit growth to industry slows to 6.5% in Aug: RBI data
items.summary: Bank credit to industry slowed to 6.5% in August 2025 from 9.7% a year ago, RBI data showed. Non-food credit rose 9.9% YoY, down from 13.6% earlier. Credit to micro, small, and medium enterprises, engineering, vehicles, and rubber-plastic sectors grew steadily.

items.title: India’s North-East monsoon onset over South peninsula may be delayed
items.summary: IMD says October to get 15% above-normal rain; TNAU forecasts near-normal monsoon

items.title: ABD inaugurates PET bottle manufacturing plant in Telangana with 600 million bottle annual capacity
items.summary: Built at an investment of around ₹115 crore, the facility enables in-house PET bottle production - reducing reliance on external suppliers, lowering logistics costs, and enhancing supply chain efficiency

items.title: GST transition, heavy rains impact FMCG sector in Q2
items.summary: Expects growth trends to stabilise from November

items.title: Frontloaded spending pushes capex 43% in April-August
items.summary: Growth momentum boosted, but weak revenues widen fiscal deficit

items.title: Paperless: DIAL to launch ‘E-Arrival Card’ facility for foreign passengers
items.summary: Delhi Airport to launch ‘E-Arrival Card’ for international passengers, streamlining arrival process and promoting sustainability

items.title: Ahead of Market: 10 things that will decide stock market action on Wednesday
items.summary: Nifty and Sensex slipped for the eighth straight session on Tuesday amid weakness in consumer, realty, and IT stocks. Analysts flagged a bearish setup with resistance near 24,800 and immediate support at 24,500, urging cautious positioning ahead of RBI policy.

items.title: RITES inks pact with Etihad Rail to boost biz collaboration in infra, mobility
items.summary: RITES Ltd, an Indian transport infrastructure firm, signed a Memorandum of Understanding with UAE-based Etihad Rail and its subsidiary, National Infrastructure Construction Company. This pact aims to enhance business collaboration in mobility and infrastructure sectors across the UAE and other regions, combining RITES' expertise with the subsidiary's execution capabilities. The agreement strengthens RITES' international footprint.

items.title: India-EFTA trade pact: Swiss wines, apparels, watches to get cheaper in India
items.summary: India’s free trade pact with EFTA, effective Wednesday, will lower tariffs on Swiss products like wines, chocolates, apparel, and watches, making them cheaper domestically. Indian exports—including tea, coffee, textiles, marine products, leather, gems, and engineering goods—will gain greater market access in Iceland, Liechtenstein, Norway, and Switzerland, boosting trade.

items.title: Oswal Energies to invest ₹320 crore in green hydrogen
items.summary: Under the plan, a 20 MW green hydrogen plant in Gujarat will be implemented in the next 12–15 months

items.title: India initiates anti-dumping probe into imports of three Chinese goods
items.summary: India initiates anti-dumping probe into imports of three Chinese goods

items.summary: Speculation rife about Dentsu’s international business, with reports saying the Japanese network wants to sell it all off

items.title: Tariff-led export pain in H1FY26 hits ratings of some firms
RBI MPC: Will the central bank hold or surprise with a rate cut?
items.summary: The RBI’s repo rate decision on Wednesday is expected to be tight, with low inflation and slowing growth from US tariffs providing reasons to ease. While most economists predict a hold at 5.5%, some expect a 25 bps cut. The central bank may keep growth forecasts unchanged but trim inflation projections, with the rupee’s weakness and cautious stance complicating easing.

items.title: India's road construction likely to slide to a 5-year low of 25-26 km per day in FY26: ICRA
items.summary: India's road construction is projected to hit a five-year low of 25-26 km per day in FY2026, Icra reported. This significant slowdown, attributed to extended monsoons and reduced project awards, follows a 14% decline last fiscal. While new ministry directives aim to boost future project awards, competitive pressures persist for contractors.

items.title: Alphabet’s AI Strength Fuels Biggest Quarterly Jump Since 2005
items.summary: Alphabet Inc. shares are on track for their biggest quarterly gain in 20 years, the latest reflection of how investors are turning more positive on the Google parent as it strengthens its foothold in artificial intelligence.

items.title: Govt to auction spectrum in 10 bands including upper 6 GHz for first time
items.summary: The telecom regulator has commenced preparations for the next spectrum auction, aiming to sell nearly 10 bands, including new ones. Following significant unsold spectrum in past auctions, Trai is deliberating ways to enhance competition and attract more buyers, potentially by reviewing auction methods, reserve pricing, and allowing new participants.

items.title: Swan Defence ties up with Samsung Heavy Industries for shipbuilding
items.summary: Both the partners will jointly explore commercial shipbuilding and heavy engineering projects across domestic and international markets

items.summary: This is also aimed at return of their unclaimed amounts lying with Depositors Education Awareness (DEA) Fund to the rightful claimant in a timely and efficient manner

items.summary: To understand the transmission dynamics, we need to acknowledge that transmission has been effective for a set of borrowers while some others have yet to gain in a similar manner.

items.title: Trai recommends 5-year spectrum limit for PMRTS operators
items.summary: The Telecom Regulatory Authority of India now recommends a five-year spectrum validity for PMRTS operators. This period can extend for another five years later. Trai changed its earlier twenty-year proposal due to technology advancements. Public mobile radio trunking service supports critical communications across various sectors. The regulator disagreed with the Department of Telecommunications' blanket five-year view.

items.title: Florintree-backed Seshaasai shares list at 3% premium over IPO price
items.summary: Seshaasai Technologies debuted on BSE at ₹436, a 3.07% premium over its IPO price of ₹423. The ₹933 crore issue saw strong demand, subscribed 68x, led by institutional investors. Founders retain 80% stake post listing.

items.title: ICICI Bank gets Rs 216 crore GST demand notice
items.summary: ICICI Bank has received a GST demand notice of Rs 216.27 crore from tax authorities for alleged short payment on services provided to customers maintaining specified minimum balances. The bank, which is already in litigation over similar issues, will file a reply to the Show Cause Notice. This matter is being reported as the amount crosses its materiality threshold.

items.summary: Indian negotiators will be in Brussels from October 6-10 for the talks

items.summary: Nifty and Sensex extended losses for an eighth session, weighed by IT, realty, and consumer stocks. Nifty faces stiff resistance near 24,750 with a bearish structure. Analysts recommend 7 stock picks including TD Power, Canara Bank, and NALCO.

items.summary: The objective of the Central bank’s liquidity management operations is to align the target rate to the policy repo rate

items.title: Global air passenger traffic to reach 9.8 billion in 2025: Reports
items.summary: Global air passenger traffic will reach 9.8 billion in 2025. This represents a 3.7 percent increase from 2024 figures. International travel will account for 4.3 billion passengers. Domestic traffic is projected at 5.5 billion passengers. Asia Pacific region traffic will hit 3.6 billion. Southern and Southeast Asia will drive this growth. East Asia's outlook remains cautious.

items.title: Nestle inks MoU with Food Processing Ministry to expedite investments
items.summary: The company said it works with over 100,000 farmers  including those in dairy, coffee, spices, wheat, sugarcane, and rice, combined with a strong supplier partnership.

items.title: Gas price for Reliance-bp cut by 3%, domestic rates remain unchanged
items.summary: The ceiling price for natural gas from deepsea and difficult fields has been cut by 3% to USD 9.72 per MMBtu for six months starting October 1. Meanwhile, rates for gas from legacy fields remain unchanged at USD 6.75 per MMBtu, adhering to a price ceiling despite a higher calculated rate. This impacts operators like Reliance-BP and state-owned firms.

items.title: Excess rains, floods cause damage to crops on over 9.6 lakh hectares in Karnataka

items.title: RBI Governor to chair new payments regulatory board
items.summary: Other members include Deputy Governor and Executive Director at RBI, DFS Secretary, Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology Secretary and Aruna Sundarajan, who is a retired IAS officer

items.title: CSM Technologies files IPO papers with Sebi
items.summary: CSM Technologies, provider of digital transformation, GovTech and IT consulting services, has filed preliminary papers with markets regulator Sebi to raise Rs 150 crore through an initial public offering (IPO).

items.title: TVS Supply Chain Solutions expands footprint in North America
items.summary: TVS Supply Chain Solutions is now targeting a revenue milestone of $500 million, a goal that reflects both its strong performance and the increasing demand for integrated supply chain solutions in the region.

items.title: Financial crime agency's search linked to toll road deal, not forex: Reliance Infrastructure
items.summary: Reliance Infrastructure stated financial crime agency searches concerned a 2010 Rajasthan toll road contract. The company denied any foreign exchange violations. Earlier reports mentioned alleged foreign exchange law breaches. Reliance Infrastructure clarified it had no connection with the contractor. The toll road has been with the National Highways Authority of India for four years.

items.title: LG Electronics India IPO to open next week: From key dates to offer details — Here are 10 things to know
items.summary: LG Electronics India's initial public offering (IPO) is scheduled to open for public subscription next week, in October 2025. The company's Korean parent will sell its stake in the firm via the public issue. Here are 10 key things to know…

items.title: Veefin Solutions to merge with its 2 subsidiaries, GlobeTF Solutions and Estorifi Solutions
items.summary: The amalgamation will give Veefin a simplified structure, stronger balance sheet and greater operational scale

items.title: India's external debt rises 1.5%, but reserves have got its back
items.summary: The external debt to GDP ratio, however, moderated to 18.9% from 19.1% three months ago. The ratio of India's international assets to international liabilities also improved to 79.25% in June 2025 from 77.6% a quarter ago. The rise in the country's outstanding liabilities was largely because of the exchange rate variations, the central bank said.

items.title: Michelin plans to increase sourcing from India for its global plants
items.summary: On Tuesday, Michelin rolled out its first Made in India passenger car tyre

items.title: Indian Overseas Bank to waive minimum balance for savings accounts
items.summary: The bank had already waived minimum balance charges for schemes like PMJDY, BSBDA, Small Accounts, IOB SB Salary Package, IOB Sixty Plus, IOB SB Pensioner Scheme and IOB SB Govt Account

items.summary: Bank Holidays in October: Banks will be closed for up to 15 days in October across different parts of India, according to the RBI holiday calendar.
